intro: Meibomia striata, commonly known as the striated meibomia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers with four petals, often in shades of white or pink. Its leaves are typically elliptical and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Meibomia striata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
